intro: Voyria stellata, commonly known as the starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Voyria stellata thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along streambanks.
